full_text: In Studio, open the SubmissionWizard.PCF file. It has a list of JobWizard steps, each of which is linked to a screen with the content. The JobWizard steps can be grouped together using WizardStepGroup. The PolicyContract is a group of steps and has a label. It contains a JobWizard step for policy info and a WizardStepSetRef pointing to a WizardStepSet. The WizardStepSet refuses modes to group different set of steps based on line of business. Selecting a different mode displays the WizardStepSet for that line of business. You can double-click to open it. The Dependent Steps are an ordered list of JobWizard steps, each of which maps to a single screen. Some steps may not be accessible until a given step is complete. The order effects where the Back and Next buttons navigate to. Each JobWizard step specifies the title of the screen. Control-click in the Screen property to visit the PCF file. The screen contains the Content, Wizard Buttons and Toolbars. The JobWizard toolbar contains Back and Next buttons to navigate through the JobWizard as well as other buttons relevant to the current step. Click the Mode for the WizardButtons. Select the appropriate JobType to display the WizardButtons for it. Go back to SubmissionWizard.PCF. The Tools section at the bottom contains the Independent Steps. Double-click to open the WizardStepSet for the Tools menu. They do not have a logical order and can be accessed at any time, regardless of what steps have been completed in the JobWizard. Click one of the steps. Each step has the Independent property set to True. The label and icon for the Independent Steps are set at the JobWizard level. Log into PolicyCenter as Alice Applegate. Open a Draft Submission. The Policy Contract is a JobWizard group and the Child Steps are indented. The Back and Next buttons navigate based on the order of Wizard Steps. Each step points to a different screen. This is the end of Overview for JobWizardState. This is the end of Overview for JobWizardState.

segments.text: In Studio, open the SubmissionWizard.PCF file. It has a list of JobWizard steps, each of which is linked to a screen with the content. The JobWizard steps can be grouped together using WizardStepGroup.
The PolicyContract is a group of steps and has a label. It contains a JobWizard step for policy info and a WizardStepSetRef pointing to a WizardStepSet.
The WizardStepSet refuses modes to group different set of steps based on line of business.
Selecting a different mode displays the WizardStepSet for that line of business. You can double-click to open it.
The Dependent Steps are an ordered list of JobWizard steps, each of which maps to a single screen. Some steps may not be accessible until a given step is complete.
The order effects where the Back and Next buttons navigate to.
Each JobWizard step specifies the title of the screen. Control-click in the Screen property to visit the PCF file.

The screen contains the Content, Wizard Buttons and Toolbars. The JobWizard toolbar contains Back and Next buttons to navigate through the JobWizard as well as other buttons relevant to the current step.
Click the Mode for the WizardButtons.
Select the appropriate JobType to display the WizardButtons for it.
Go back to SubmissionWizard.PCF.
The Tools section at the bottom contains the Independent Steps.
Double-click to open the WizardStepSet for the Tools menu.
They do not have a logical order and can be accessed at any time, regardless of what steps have been completed in the JobWizard.
Click one of the steps.
Each step has the Independent property set to True.
The label and icon for the Independent Steps are set at the JobWizard level.
Log into PolicyCenter as Alice Applegate.
Open a Draft Submission.
The Policy Contract is a JobWizard group and the Child Steps are indented.
The Back and Next buttons navigate based on the order of Wizard Steps.
Each step points to a different screen.
This is the end of Overview for JobWizardState.
This is the end of Overview for JobWizardState.
